column4: once i put a .ttf font in /usr/share/fonts/truetype do i have to re-login for xterm*font to recognize it?
verify the fonts you added are owned by root and then in /usr/local/share/fonts/tryptype (did you copy them here?) run "fc-cache" and see if that helps
see you put the link in your post try fc-cache in /usr/share/fonts/truetype
hmm tried it but xterm still says it cant load the font
does xterm actually use TTF fonts?
actually Chromium is the opensource project they base Chrome off of.

no really advantage to chromium right now -- does your chrome have bookmark syncing?  if not it's not the newest Chrome (there are a couple of bugs with Chromium that made there way into Google Chrome)

i meant that the 'ubuntu-bug' is the command line tool, and the only way to send a bug report from ubuntu 10.04 lts
ubuntu-bug needs a package name after it
if you dont supply a package name it will try to help you diagnose the symptoms
